Test Description: Assess basic optimization problems using small set of tiles.
Difficulty Notes: Focusing on a subset of the score optimization problems. This time, giving it a score and asking it to derive the solution
Question: What sets of two dominoes would combine to yield a score of 2? You may only select one domino per column. Output as Dominoes Combinations: List[Tuple(domino, domino)] e.g. [(A, E), (B,F), (B, H)]
Rationale: C is crucial as it contains a one-crown lake tile that could then be paired with a blank lake tile. Namely, F and H are lake tiles without crowns, resulting in 1x2 = 2 points. Most other combinations like this yield 1x3, 3x1 or 2x2 points
